channel.title: animal on VRchina.cc
channel.description: Recent content in animal on VRchina.cc

item.title: A Panoramic View of China Â
item.description: Since the introduction of economic reforms in 1978, China’s economy has been one of the world’s fastest-growing. As of 2016, China is the world’s second-largest economy by nominal GDP and the largest by purchasing power parity.

item.title: Chinese River Dolphin
item.description: The Chinese river dolphin is a freshwater dolphin and one of the most endangered animals on Earth. It is also known as the Yangtze River dolphin, baiji, white-flag dolphin, and white-fin dolphin.

item.title: Crested Ibis
item.description: The crested ibis is a rare and precious species in the world. In history, crested ibises were widely distributed in East Asia. Since the middle of the 20th century, its population has reduced rapidly due to the change of the inadaptable environment caused by human activities, such as the decrease of the rice fields, the wide applications of fertilizers and pesticides and the reduction of forest area.

item.title: Golden Snub-nosed Monkey
item.description: The beautiful golden snub-nosed monkey has blackish-grey shoulders, upper arms, back, crown, and tail, with the back being covered in a longer layer of fine silver hairs. In males, the sides of the head, forehead, and neck and underparts are a bright golden color, hence the common name of this species.

item.title: The Chinese Dragon
item.description: The Chinese dragon, “Long” in Chinese, is a symbol of propitious omens and good fortune. The Chinese dragon has many faces, nine sons and multiple cosmic roles. It is everywhere- in the clouds and heavens, in the rivers, the oceans and in the underworld where it guards jewels and precious metals and creates volcanoes when it bursts out to report to heaven.

item.title: The Story of Nezha
item.description: According to the work Fengshen Bang, Nezha was born during the Shang Dynasty in a military fortress at Chentang Pass. His father was a military commander named Li Jing, who later became the “Pagoda-wielding Heavenly King”.
